definitions: Recorded the time taken for an event or activity.
Achieved or registered a particular speed or time.
Hit someone, especially on the head.
Noticed or observed something, especially something subtle or hidden.
Registered a certain number or amount, especially on a meter or odometer.
examples: The runner clocked a new personal best.
He clocked the car at over 100 mph.
She clocked him right in the jaw.
I clocked the suspicious look he gave.
The old car had clocked over 200,000 miles.
